metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4187 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
vim is vulnerable to Use After Free

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2').
